summary: Email chain between federal prosecutors discussing the need for Bureau of Prisons reports regarding the July 23, 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein, and a separate discussion about obtaining travel records for an individual connected to Epstein, revealing extensive flight purchase data.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of investigation; his American Express cards were used to purchase thousands of flights over ten years, including tickets for others.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Requests Bureau of Prisons reports and documentation regarding the July 23 incident and suicide watch for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: July 23 Incident at MCC
events.description: Incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, prompting requests for Bureau of Prisons reports and suicide watch documentation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein primarily booked flights for others using American Express cards associated with him.
Records show more than 4,800 flights purchased by Epstein in the ten years prior to 2019.
Federal prosecutors were seeking Bureau of Prisons reports and suicide watch documentation related to the July 23, 2019 incident involving Epstein at MCC.
Prosecutors were also inquiring about travel records for an individual (name redacted) connected to Epstein, with records dating from 2011 to July 2019.
The email chain indicates coordination between prosecutors to share large data files, such as flight records, via shared drives.
